content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 17 ยง 8000.7 - Authorized vehicles

State Regulations
(a) The
following vehicles and combinations of vehicles which otherwise conform to
legal dimensions and weights are authorized to operate on all qualifying
highways and all access highways unless otherwise specified in Parts 8000 and
8100 of these Regulations: (1)
A
tractor-semitrailer-trailer combination where neither the semitrailer nor the
trailer exceeds 281/2 feet in length, and a width not to exceed 102
inches. (2)
A tractor-semitrailer
combination with an overall length greater than 65 feet, in which the
semitrailer does not exceed 48 feet in length, and width of not more than 102
inches. (3)
A combination of an
automotive powered cab and truck chassis being used to tow three such
additional vehicles in triple saddle-mount fashion each mounted upon a device
designed and constructed so as to be readily dismountable and which performs
the function of a conventional fifth-wheel, so that while all the wheels of the
towing power chassis touch the roadway, only the wheels on the rear axle on
each of the towed vehicles are in contact with the roadway. (4)
A stinger-steered automobile transporter
of a total length not greater than 75 feet exclusive of an overhang of not more
than three feet on the front and four feet on the rear of the vehicle
configured as a semitrialer combination wherein the fifth wheel is located on a
drop frame located behind and below the rear-most axle of the power
unit. (5)
A "maxi-cube" vehicle
consisting of a truck tracker combined with a semitrailer and a seperable cargo
carrying unit which is designed to be loaded through the semitrailer, except
that the entire combination shall not exceed 65 feet in length and the
separable cargo carrying unit shall not exceed 34 feet in length. (b) A tractor-semitrailer
combination in which the semitrailer is of a length greater than 48 feet but
not greater than 53 feet, provided the distance between the kingpin of the
semitrailer and the centerline of the rear axle or rear axle group does not
exceed 41 feet, and which is equipped with a rear-end protective device of
substantial construction consisting of a continuous lateral beam extending to
within four inches of the lateral extremities of the semitrailer and located
not more than 22 inches from the surface as measured with the vehicle empty and
on a level surface, otherwise conforming to legal dimensions and weights, is
authorized to operate on all qualifying highways and access highways outside of
the City of New York, unless otherwise specified in Parts 8000 and 8100 of
these Regulations, and, in addition, may operate on that portion of IR 95 which
connects IR 287 with IR 295; on that portion of IR 295 which portion of IR 295
which connects IR 95 with IR 495; and that portion of IR 495 between IR 95 and
the Nassau-Queens county line, all in New York City. Notes
